newsitem.title: UK: Sugar freight sees fixtures while Santos on strike.
newsitem.headline: Sugar freight sees fixtures while Santos on strike.

text.p: London's sugar freight market saw a host of new fixtures and orders on Friday while the Brazilian key sugar port of Santos was crippled by a 24-hour strike.

Brokers said E.D. & F. Man fixed on subjects 14,000-15,000 tonnes bulk sugar from Maceio/Recife to Algeria or Black Sea for October dates. It also fixed on subjects 12,000-14,000 tonnes bagged sugar east coast Mexico to Colombo for early November.
Cargill fixed on subjects 25,000 tonnes bulk from Santos to Morocco, Egyptian Med or the Black Sea for end October.
Louis Dreyfus fixed 11,900 tonnes bagged sugar from the Continent to the Turkish Med for October or November dates.
Another firm fixture was by the South African Sugar Association who fixed 20,000 tonnes bulk from Durban to Singapore for October/November.

Two new orders were from E.D. & F. Man for 6,000 bagged sugar Zeebrugge to Algeria for October/November and Glencore for 14,000-15,500 tonnes bulk from Santos to the Black Sea, Morocco or the Mediterannean, shipbrokers said.

Loading of sugar vessels in Santos came to a virtual halt on on Friday as administrative portworkers began a one-day strike. Strikers said although no further stoppages are planned, much would depend on ongoing negotiations with the port authority.
